content:
It depends how you measure it

WHAT IS “Midwestern nice”? It is apologising involuntarily when scooting past someone, both to warn of your presence and to express regret for any inconvenience your mere existence may have caused. It is greeting people as they step into a lift and wishing them well as they leave. It is a strong preference for avoiding confrontation. Anecdotes abound suggesting that the Midwest is indeed America’s most congenial region. But the hard data are more nuanced.

Of the five American cities with the highest rates of Volunteerism in 2017, two are in the Midwest, according to the Corporation for National and Community Service , a federal agency devoted to promoting Volunteering. Just over 46% of people living near Minneapolis and St Paul in Minnesota say they Volunteer regularly, the most of any major metropolitan area. “Midwestern nice” is a descriptor heard around America, but there are varying levels of geniality within the Midwest itself. “Minnesota nice” is supposedly the zenith. Milwaukee, Wisconsin comes in at number four with 44.6% of its residents Volunteering. The national average hovers around 30%. Volunteering, though, demands the luxury of free time as well as goodwill. So as a measure of “niceness”, it falls short.

A study in 2013 from Cambridge university found that distinct personality traits are more common in specific regions of America. Using surveys and voluntary data from Facebook, researchers analysed the personality traits of 1.5m people and determined that people living in “Middle America” are more likely to be friendly and agreeable. They are also prone to harbour more conservative social and political views.

An analysis of charitable giving seems to tell a slightly different story. The metropolitan areas in which residents gave the highest percentage of their earnings to charity are disproportionally located in America’s South, according to a report by the Chronicle of Philanthropy in 2015. This may be because so many southerners are religious. Indeed, many of the charities to which they donate are churches. On average, residents of Birmingham, Alabama gave 5.4% of their incomes to charity in 2015—more than any other metro area except Salt Lake City in Utah. Alabama, Pew Research Centre found, is also the most religious state in America.

Overall, which region seems nicest depends on how you measure it. It is hard, however, to find a measure that suggests that the nicest part of America is the Northeast.

这里几乎所有居民都是公国的住户，公国在村子里设有区域办事处。
Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

ex: vi. 溜走；快走；骑轻便摩托车
eg2: Then I quickly  my chair back and head for the shower.
然后我迅速向后挪开椅子，进浴室洗澡。
's primary aim is keep traffic flowing smoothly and pedestrians safe.
的首要目标是保持交通顺畅和步行者安全。
The widely used Split, Cycle and Offset Optimisation Technique () is popular with those responsible for traffic control.
颇受欢迎的绿信比、周期和相位差优化技术（）现在已得到广泛使用，负责对交通进行控制。

ex: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许

eg2: That was her .
那是她的特点。
For every , you can interpret it in a positive and a negative manner.
对于每一个特点，你都能用积极和消极的态度来解释它。
Of all the possible reasons one might think or justify it’s down to the obtuse chains of a  I get from my Mother: hoarding (!).
在所有可能的原因中，有一个可以解释或有理由认为它已经成了迟钝的枷锁。 一钟源于我母亲的特点：囤积。

ex: adj. 自愿的；志愿的；自发的；故意的
eg2: Also, treatment should be  as far as possible, while service users should have plenty of contact and companionship with other service users.
另外，应当尽可能做到自愿接受治疗，而且服务使用者应当与使用服务的其他人有广泛的联系和友谊。
One should respect public opinion insofar as is necessary to avoid starvation and keep out of prison, but anything that goes beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny.
为了避免饿死和不进监狱，一个人应当尊重公众意见，但是除了这些目的之外如果还这么做，那就是对不必要专制的自愿遵从。
Participation in the program would be  and participants could prepay the government loan at any time.
参加这以项目是自愿的，参与者可以在任何时间将贷款预付给政府。
